intro: Ageratina subintegra, commonly known as the white mistflower, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its finely divided, gray-green leaves and fluffy, white inflorescences that resemble mist. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Ageratina subintegra is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
